column4: i'm trying to install something but it says package architecture i386 does not match system (amd64) with dpkg is there any way to install it?
Sounds like you're trying to install a 32bit package on a 64bit system (wont work, you need the 64bit package)
i don't think it has a 64 bit version, theres no way to install it then eh?
Hmm.. looks cool but I can't tell what packages they have available without an account
oh well ;\, do you know of something better supported or free that can do the same kind of thing? :d
Well I think it's possible to run 32bit applications on 64bit but I'm not sure of the details. I just know natively, a 32bit deb can't run on 64bit
I don't know of any though I haven't looked
They seem to have a legitimate site though so try contacting their support team
they had an sh script for 'other linux' and that seems to have installed it
it needs firefox to handle smgp:// links
Ahh.. you need to do stuff in about:config
i added network.protocol-handler.app.smgp but it still isn't working ;\
Yea I would have to try to get it working myself..
